That's a great idea! Sashiko embroidery can add a unique and beautiful touch to your quilt project. It's a wonderful way to incorporate a personal touch and make the quilt even more special for your brother and his partner.

Remember to take your time and enjoy the process. Sashiko embroidery can be a meditative and calming activity, so try to relax and have fun with it. Don't worry if your stitches aren't perfect at first – it's all part of the learning process, and it's okay to make mistakes.

If you do decide to incorporate sashiko embroidery into your quilt project, you might consider using a simple running stitch or a small geometric pattern to start with. This will allow you to get a feel for the stitches and the fabric before moving on to more complex designs.

Also, keep in mind that sashiko embroidery can be a time-consuming process, so be sure to factor that into your project timeline. You might want to start with a small section or a single block and see how it turns out before committing to a larger design.

I'm excited to hear that you're considering incorporating sashiko embroidery into your quilt project. I think it will add a beautiful and unique touch to the finished quilt. If you have any more questions or need further guidance, don't hesitate to ask.
